Key Match Events: Zebby Matthews surrendered a leadoff home run to Taylor Ward in the first inning.
Matt Wallner hit a 435-foot, 110.3-mph blast to center in the second inning, tying the score at 1-1.
Nolan Schanuel took Matthews deep in the third inning, putting the Angels back up 2-1.
Willi Castro broke his personal 0-15 streak with a game-tying knock in the fourth inning.
Royce Lewis drove a ball off the top of the wall in left field, extending the lead to 6-3 but not adding to his historic totals.
Jhoan Dur√°n delivered in the bottom of the eighth, sending the game toward lights-out time.
Pre-Game Insights: Rocco Baldelli appeared to approach the game before the off day almost like a playoff game, with short hooks for the pitchers, lineup configurations to stack the hottest (and coldest) batters, and other machinations often reserved for the season's most important contests.
Post-Match Reflections: The relative tension left after the lead stretched only to three, rather than five, meant that Griffin Jax came back out in the bottom of the eighth.
Fans can count on a prepared and rallying Twins squad, and a Chris Young after-game concert to look forward to!
Miscellaneous Highlights: Eric Wagaman came to the plate in only his second major-league at-bat, and flew out to end the threat in the first inning.

The Twins honored those who died on Sept. 11, 2001, with a flyover by military aircraft, with Jax's brother and sister-in-law serving as two of the four pilots, and his other brother tossing the first pitch.
